moves.1. c4 Nf6 2. Nc3 e6 3. a3: Unnecessary. If Black plays ...Bb4, you can play Qc2 and you have no problems.
Putting all your centre pawns on white squares means that you have less control over the black squares.
moves.9... Ng4 10. Ng5: I think the best option here was to play the simple 10.h3.
moves.10... Nge5: It appears that Black is now threatening to win a piece.
moves.11... h6: If Black plays 11...Bxg5 White has 12.Bxe5 Nxe5 13.f4, winning the piece back.
moves.12. Nf3 Nxf3+ 13. Bxf3 Nd4: The black square weakness that I mentioned earlier now manifests itself.
moves.14. Be3 Nxf3+ 15. Qxf3 d6 16. Qg4 Bg5 17: I think I would have preferred 17.f4 here.
